newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Brazil coffee seen frost-free in coming days - Somar.
newsitem.headline: Brazil coffee seen frost-free in coming days - Somar.

text.p: Brazil's coffee areas are expected to remain cool but free from frost over the coming days, said local private meteorologist Somar.

A polar air mass already started to move out to sea from the far south of the country. But in its wake, temperatures will fall to minimum levels of around eight degrees Celsius in the country's colder coffee regions from Thursday morning.
There was, however, no frost forecast for any of Brazil's coffee areas, said forecaster Marcos Massari.
"The outlook for Friday and Saturday morning is the same and then temperatures will start to pick up again on Sunday (June 1)," Massari said.
Another polar air mass is then expected to arrive in the far south of the country on May 3.
But like the current air mass, the next front is coming in from the sea and so will be humid, again posing no frost threat, Massari said. ((-Caroline Bulloch, Rio de Janeiro newsroom, 5521 5074151))
